choices.B: To disrupt the NetBIOS SMB service on the target host
choices.A: To discover proxy servers on a network
choices.D: To discover information about a target host using NBTSTAT
choices.C: To check for file and print sharing on Windows systems

questions.question_text: Why would an attacker want to perform a scan on port 137?

discussion.content:
Microsoft encapsulates netbios information within
TCP/Ip using ports 135-139. It is trivial for an attacker to issue the following command:
nbtstat -A (your Ip address)
from their windows machine and collect information about your windows machine (if you are not blocking traffic to port 137 at your borders).

choices.D: It is used by all network devices on the market.
choices.B: It uses community string that is transmitted in clear text.
choices.A: It used TCP as the underlying protocol.

questions.question_text: SNMP is a protocol used to query hosts, servers, and devices about performance or health status data. This protocol has long been used by hackers to gather great amount of information about remote hosts. Which of the following features makes this possible? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BC
We cannot say that D is true. Not all network devices use SNMP. However, it's susceptible to sniffing, especially in its version 1 and 2
The SID for the Administrator account in Windows always ends in 500

Selected Answer: F
my first submission was made in error. google said windows server 2000 sid for root is 500

Selected Answer: A
according to google, windows 2000 sid for administrator is 500

questions.question_text:
One of your team members has asked you to analyze the following SOA record.
What is the TTL? Rutgers.edu.SOA NS1.Rutgers.edu ipad.college.edu (200302028 3600 3600 604800 2400.)

discussion.content:
D is the correct answer :(200302028 3600 3600 604800 2400)
200302028 = Serial Number
3600 = Refresh
3600 = Retry
604800 = Expire
2400 = Minimum TTL

comments.content: Sorry A is the correct answer D for another question
